options: Has the smallest remaining legal domain

options: Min-conflicts reasons about constraints, backtracking does not
Min-conflicts improves a complete assignment, backtracking builds one

questions.question: What does an independent subproblem mean in a CSP?
options: A problem where all variables are connected to each other
A subproblem that can be solved separately, and its solution combined with others gives a solution for the whole CSP
A subproblem that requires backtracking to solve
A problem that has only one solution

questions.question: How can independent subproblems be identified in a CSP?
options: By finding connected components in the constraint graph

questions.question: What is the time complexity of solving n/c independent subproblems, each of size c with domain size d?
A tree-structured CSP has the property that:
options: Every variable is connected to every other variable
There is only one path between any two variables

questions.question: What is directional arc consistency (DAC) in a tree-structured CSP?
options: Every variable is arc-consistent with all previous variables
Every variable is arc-consistent with each variable that comes after it in a chosen ordering
Every variable has only one allowed value

questions.question: What is a topological sort in the context of tree-structured CSPs?
options: Ordering variables such that each variable appears after its parent
Sorting domain values of each variable

questions.question: Why does TREE-CSP-SOLVER not require backtracking?
options: Because domains are all single values
Because DAC ensures that for any value chosen for a parent, the child has at least one consistent value
Because the algorithm uses symmetry breaking

questions.question: What is a cycle cutset in CSPs?
options: A variable with a single value
A subset of variables that, when assigned, turns the remaining constraint graph into a tree
A variable that breaks value symmetry
A constraint that connects all variables

questions.question: What is the time complexity of cutset conditioning?
What is the main idea of tree decomposition?
options: To assign values to variables one by one
To transform the constraint graph into a tree of clusters of variables
To apply min-conflicts to all variables

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a requirement of a tree decomposition?
options: Every variable appears in at least one tree node
Every pair of connected variables in the original graph appear together in at least one node
A variable appearing in multiple nodes must appear in every node along the path connecting those nodes
Every node must contain all variables in the CSP

questions.question: What is tree width?
options: Number of variables in a CSP
One less than the size of the largest node in a tree decomposition
The maximum number of constraints per variable
Number of edges in the constraint graph

questions.question: How can CSPs with bounded tree width be solved?
options: In polynomial time using TREE-CSP-SOLVER on the tree decomposition

questions.question: What is value symmetry in CSPs?
options: Equivalent solutions obtained by permuting variable values
A CSP with all domains equal
Symmetric domains for a single variable

questions.question: How can value symmetry be reduced?
Why is breaking value symmetry helpful?
options: It reduces the search space by eliminating equivalent solutions
It converts the graph into a tree

questions.question: Two subproblems of a CSP are independent if:
options: Their constraints do not connect them
Any solution of one can combine with any solution of the other
They have the same number of variables

options: Every variable to be arc-consistent with all others

Arc consistency enforced only on leaves

questions.question: In tree-structured CSPs, choosing a topological sort ensures:
options: Each parent appears after its children
Each parent appears before its children

questions.question: Cutset conditioning works by:
options: Collapsing nodes into a single variable
Assigning values to variables so the remaining graph is a tree

questions.question: The cycle cutset is:
options: A subset of variables that, when removed, makes the graph a tree

questions.question: Time complexity of cutset conditioning is:

options: Every variable appears in exactly one node

Variables can skip nodes along paths

options: Each variable has a unique domain
Consistency of variable assignments across nodes

questions.question: Solving a tree decomposition CSP using TREE-CSP-SOLVER has complexity:
Tree width is:
options: The number of nodes minus one
One less than the size of the largest node
Minimum number of edges to remove to get a tree
Maximum degree of the constraint graph

questions.question: CSPs with bounded tree width are:
options: Solvable in polynomial time given the decomposition

questions.question: Value symmetry in CSPs arises because:
options: Permuting values produces multiple equivalent solutions

questions.question: Breaking value symmetry can be achieved by:
options: Enforcing an arbitrary ordering on values

questions.question: Symmetry-breaking constraints:
options: Reduce the search space by factor of d!
